channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Do phone sleep trackers work?
item.description: Are sleep trackers on your phone helping you get a full night's rest? NPR's Life Kit investigates.
item.content:encoded: Are sleep trackers on your phone helping you get a full night's rest? NPR's Life Kit investigates.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Fewer orphans globally, due to HIV medication provided by the U.S.
item.description: Until last year, the number of children orphaned because a parent died from AIDS, was plummeting. That's thanks to America's 20 year effort to get lifesaving HIV meds to millions in need. But last years upheaval in foreign aid funding is raising concern that more children will be at risk of losing a parent to the deadly virus.
item.content:encoded: Until last year, the number of children orphaned because a parent died from AIDS, was plummeting. That's thanks to America's 20 year effort to get lifesaving HIV meds to millions in need. But last years upheaval in foreign aid funding is raising concern that more children will be at risk of losing a parent to the deadly virus.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: College football's underdog this season: Trinidad Chambliss
item.description: Between pre-game prayers with his mom and spectacular throwing arm talent, Trinidad Chambliss' underdog college football story this season has excited fans across the country.
item.content:encoded: Between pre-game prayers with his mom and spectacular throwing arm talent, Trinidad Chambliss' underdog college football story this season has excited fans across the country.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: How childbearing choices have changed across three generations in one family
item.description: Fewer women are having children than a few generations ago. Sarah McCammon talks with three generations of women in one Atlanta family to understand how opportunities and choices have changed.
item.content:encoded: Fewer women are having children than a few generations ago. Sarah McCammon talks with three generations of women in one Atlanta family to understand how opportunities and choices have changed.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: At the movies: the case for and against musicals
item.description: Since the first sound film came out, Hollywood musicals have provided some of the most iconic movie moments. Three NPR movie fans discuss the merits and drawbacks of the genre.
item.content:encoded: Since the first sound film came out, Hollywood musicals have provided some of the most iconic movie moments. Three NPR movie fans discuss the merits and drawbacks of the genre.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Race to populate the border between India and China
item.description: India said it would help create hundreds of "vibrant villages" along its border with China. Three years later, residents wonder where they are.
item.content:encoded: India said it would help create hundreds of "vibrant villages" along its border with China. Three years later, residents wonder where they are.
item.dc:creator: Omkar Khandekar

item.title: In Los Angeles, Iranian-Americans march against government crackdown in Iran
item.description: Marchers gathered Sunday in downtown L.A. against the Iranian crackdown on the protests that have taken place over recent weeks.
item.content:encoded: Marchers gathered Sunday in downtown L.A. against the Iranian crackdown on the protests that have taken place over recent weeks.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Fear and internet blackouts make communication difficult for Iranians
item.description: While fears of an imminent US operation in Iran have receded, tensions remain sky high as street protests continue and communication is difficult due to fear and internet blackouts.
item.content:encoded: While fears of an imminent US operation in Iran have receded, tensions remain sky high as street protests continue and communication is difficult due to fear and internet blackouts.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: As ACA enrollment drops, hopes for Congress to restore funding are fading
item.description: ACA enrollment is down for the first time in 5 years, and people are facing enormous premium hikes. Hopes for Congress to restore funding are fading.
item.content:encoded: ACA enrollment is down for the first time in 5 years, and people are facing enormous premium hikes. Hopes for Congress to restore funding are fading.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Escalating tensions in Minnesota
item.description: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd
